item.name: Accorder Paladin
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."

item.name: Ardent Recruit
item.text: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
item.flavorText: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."

item.name: Banishment Decree
item.text: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: "Unworthy of consecration." —Axsh, lesser cenobite

item.name: Choking Fumes
item.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
item.flavorText: "Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace." —Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn

item.name: Divine Offering
item.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
item.flavorText: "The Phyrexians are vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!" —Juryan, rebel leader

item.name: Frantic Salvage
item.text: Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library. Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."

item.name: Gore Vassal
item.text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
item.flavorText: "Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers." —Tome of Machines, verse 1703

item.name: Hero of Bladehold
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.) Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.

item.name: Kemba's Legion
item.text: Vigilance Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
item.flavorText: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.

item.name: Leonin Relic-Warder
item.text: When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment. When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

item.name: Leonin Skyhunter
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: "The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."

item.name: Loxodon Partisan
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."

item.name: Master's Call
item.text: Put two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.

item.name: Mirran Crusader
item.text: Double strike, protection from black and from green
item.flavorText: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

item.name: Phyrexian Rebirth
item.text: Destroy all creatures, then put an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
item.flavorText: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.

item.name: Priests of Norn
item.text: Vigilance Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: "May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken." —Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

item.name: Tine Shrike
item.text: Flying Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

item.name: Victory's Herald
item.text: Flying Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.

item.name: White Sun's Zenith
item.text: Put X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens onto the battlefield. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
item.flavorText: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.

item.name: Blue Sun's Zenith
item.text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
item.flavorText: "The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it." —Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

item.name: Consecrated Sphinx
item.text: Flying Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
item.flavorText: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

item.name: Corrupted Conscience
item.text: Enchant creature You control enchanted creature. Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: Karn's creation is now his master.

item.name: Cryptoplasm
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.
item.flavorText: "If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them." —Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

item.name: Distant Memories
item.text: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
item.flavorText: "The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished." —Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

item.name: Fuel for the Cause
item.text: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
item.flavorText: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."

item.name: Mirran Spy
item.text: Flying Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
item.flavorText: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

item.name: Mitotic Manipulation
item.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
item.flavorText: "They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?" —Venser

item.name: Neurok Commando
item.text: Shroud Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."

item.name: Oculus
item.text: When Oculus is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: "In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist." —Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

item.name: Quicksilver Geyser
item.text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
item.flavorText: "Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever." —Tezzeret

item.name: Serum Raker
item.text: Flying When Serum Raker is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player discards a card.
item.flavorText: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.

item.name: Spire Serpent
item.text: Defender Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
item.flavorText: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.

item.name: Steel Sabotage
item.text: Choose one — Counter target artifact spell; or return target artifact to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work." —Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

item.name: Treasure Mage
item.text: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

item.name: Turn the Tide
item.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius." —Varil, Neurok partisan

item.name: Vedalken Anatomist
item.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
item.flavorText: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

item.name: Vedalken Infuser
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.
item.flavorText: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."

item.name: Vivisection
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Vivisection, sacrifice a creature. Draw three cards.
item.flavorText: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.

item.name: Black Sun's Zenith
item.text: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
item.flavorText: "Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection." —Geth, Lord of the Vault

item.name: Caustic Hound
item.text: When Caustic Hound is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player loses 4 life.
item.flavorText: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.

item.name: Flensermite
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

item.name: Flesh-Eater Imp
item.text: Flying Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

item.name: Go for the Throat
item.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
item.flavorText: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

item.name: Gruesome Encore
item.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

item.name: Horrifying Revelation
item.text: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: "Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines." —Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

item.name: Massacre Wurm
item.text: When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn. Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 2 life.

item.name: Morbid Plunder
item.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

item.name: Nested Ghoul
item.text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space." —Gyed, Vault Priest

item.name: Phyresis
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: "Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made compleat." —Sheoldred, Whispering One

item.name: Phyrexian Crusader
item.text: First strike, protection from red and from white Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

item.name: Phyrexian Rager
item.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
item.flavorText: "I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first." —Sheoldred, Whispering One

item.name: Phyrexian Vatmother
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.

item.name: Sangromancer
item.text: Flying Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 3 life. Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

item.name: Scourge Servant
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: "The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions." —Sheoldred, Whispering One

item.name: Septic Rats
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

item.name: Spread the Sickness
item.text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
item.flavorText: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

item.name: Virulent Wound
item.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature is put into a graveyard this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
item.flavorText: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."

item.name: Blisterstick Shaman
item.text: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

item.name: Burn the Impure
item.text: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
item.flavorText: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.

item.name: Concussive Bolt
item.text: Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player. Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
item.flavorText: Shock one, awe the rest.

item.name: Crush
item.text: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
item.flavorText: A golem's hands know no tenderness.

item.name: Galvanoth
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
item.flavorText: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

item.name: Gnathosaur
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.

item.name: Goblin Wardriver
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "A true warrior fights with whatever's handy." —Qerk of the Secret Warren

item.name: Hellkite Igniter
item.text: Flying, haste {1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
item.flavorText: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.

item.name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
item.text: Haste Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.) Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.

item.name: Into the Core
item.text: Exile two target artifacts.
item.flavorText: "They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom." —Kethek, furnace stoker

item.name: Koth's Courier
item.text: Forestwalk
item.flavorText: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.

item.name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
item.text: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

item.name: Kuldotha Ringleader
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.) Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.
item.flavorText: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.

item.name: Metallic Mastery
item.text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "All will be reforged in the fires of glory." —Urabrask the Hidden

item.name: Ogre Resister
item.flavorText: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

item.name: Rally the Forces
item.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!" —Koth of the Hammer

item.name: Red Sun's Zenith
item.text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

item.name: Slagstorm
item.text: Choose one — Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature; or Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
item.flavorText: "As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons." —Koth of the Hammer

item.name: Spiraling Duelist
item.text: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
item.flavorText: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."

item.name: Blightwidow
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.) Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

item.name: Creeping Corrosion
item.text: Destroy all artifacts.
item.flavorText: "We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are." —Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

item.name: Fangren Marauder
item.text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
item.flavorText: "The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves." —Tilien, Sylvok partisan

item.name: Glissa's Courier
item.text: Mountainwalk
item.flavorText: "So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form." —Glissa

item.name: Green Sun's Zenith
item.text: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
item.flavorText: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.

item.name: Lead the Stampede
item.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

item.name: Melira's Keepers
item.text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.
item.flavorText: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

item.name: Mirran Mettle
item.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.
item.flavorText: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

item.name: Phyrexian Hydra
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) If damage would be dealt to Phyrexian Hydra, prevent that damage. Put a -1/-1 counter on Phyrexian Hydra for each 1 damage prevented this way.

item.name: Pistus Strike
item.text: Destroy target creature with flying. Its controller gets a poison counter.
item.flavorText: "Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world." —Glissa

item.name: Plaguemaw Beast
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
item.flavorText: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.

item.name: Praetor's Counsel
item.text: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
item.flavorText: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.

item.name: Quilled Slagwurm
item.flavorText: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

item.name: Rot Wolf
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn is put into a graveyard, you may draw a card.

item.name: Tangle Mantis
item.text: Trample
item.flavorText: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They are the mantises.

item.name: Thrun, the Last Troll
item.text: Thrun, the Last Troll can't be countered. Thrun can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. {1}{G}: Regenerate Thrun.
item.flavorText: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.

item.name: Unnatural Predation
item.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now." —Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

item.name: Viridian Corrupter
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) When Viridian Corrupter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

item.name: Viridian Emissary
item.text: When Viridian Emissary is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

item.name: Glissa, the Traitor
item.text: First strike, deathtouch Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

item.name: Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas
item.text: +1: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. -1: Target artifact becomes a 5/5 artifact creature. -4: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is twice the number of artifacts you control.

item.name: Bladed Sentinel
item.text: {W}: Bladed Sentinel gains vigilance until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.

item.name: Blightsteel Colossus
item.text: Trample, infect Blightsteel Colossus is indestructible. If Blightsteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Blightsteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

item.name: Bonehoard
Brass Squire
item.text: {T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
item.flavorText: "I admire it. Few pull off pluck and subservience at the same time." —Ezuri, renegade leader

item.name: Copper Carapace
item.text: Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and can't block. Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
item.flavorText: "We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal." —Tae Aquil, Viridan weaponsmith

item.name: Core Prowler
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) When Core Prowler is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

item.name: Darksteel Plate
item.flavorText: "If there can be no victory, then I will fight forever." —Koth of the Hammer

item.name: Decimator Web
item.text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

item.name: Dross Ripper
item.text: {2}{B}: Dross Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Such a creation serves no purpose other than exterminating every one of us." —Sadra Alic, Neurok strategist

item.name: Flayer Husk
item.text: Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.) Equipped creature gets +1/+1. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

item.name: Gust-Skimmer
item.text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.

item.name: Hexplate Golem
item.flavorText: "Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . . even the ground must join our cause." —Ezuri, renegade leader

item.name: Ichor Wellspring
item.text: When Ichor Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Our glorious infection has taken hold." —Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

item.name: Knowledge Pool
item.text: Imprint — When Knowledge Pool enters the battlefield, each player exiles the top three cards of his or her library. Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand, that player exiles it. If the player does, he or she may cast another nonland card exiled with Knowledge Pool without paying that card's mana cost.

item.name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: "Anything that watches without sleep and fights without fear is a valuable ally against the Phyrexians." —Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

item.name: Magnetic Mine
item.text: Whenever another artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Magnetic Mine deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.

item.name: Mirrorworks
item.text: Whenever another nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that artifact onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: The faces of Geth's corpse-dredgers are disturbingly similar.

item.name: Mortarpod
Myr Sire
item.text: When Myr Sire is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

item.name: Myr Turbine
item.text: {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield. {T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

item.name: Myr Welder
item.text: Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.
item.flavorText: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.

item.name: Peace Strider
item.text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
item.flavorText: "The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle." —Kessla, Sylvok shaman

item.name: Phyrexian Digester
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
item.flavorText: "Our cause will ripen in the fertile flesh of the unworthy." —Sheoldred, Whispering One

item.name: Phyrexian Juggernaut
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) Phyrexian Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
item.flavorText: Where nature impedes, Phyrexians overcome.

item.name: Phyrexian Revoker
item.text: As Phyrexian Revoker enters the battlefield, name a nonland card. Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated.
item.flavorText: Basic senses like sight and taste are reserved for those in power.

item.name: Pierce Strider
item.text: When Pierce Strider enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life.
item.flavorText: "Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection." —Sheoldred, Whispering One

item.name: Piston Sledge
item.text: When Piston Sledge enters the battlefield, attach it to target creature you control. Equipped creature gets +3/+1. Equip—Sacrifice an artifact.
item.flavorText: Only the goblins could make a simple machine so complex.

item.name: Plague Myr
item.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.) {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: They watch for a new master, one more sinister than the last.

item.name: Psychosis Crawler
item.text: Psychosis Crawler's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand. Whenever you draw a card, each opponent loses 1 life.
item.flavorText: "If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains." —Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

item.name: Razorfield Rhino
item.text: Metalcraft — Razorfield Rhino gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
item.flavorText: Adapted to tread on razorgrass, the rhino proved adept at treading on Phyrexians as well.

item.name: Rusted Slasher
item.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Regenerate Rusted Slasher.
item.flavorText: "It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity." —Urabrask the Hidden

item.name: Shimmer Myr
item.text: Flash You may cast artifact cards as though they had flash.
item.flavorText: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.

item.name: Shriekhorn
item.text: Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it. {T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

item.name: Signal Pest
item.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.) Signal Pest can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
item.flavorText: It leaps from tree to tree, revealing the enemy's positions.

item.name: Silverskin Armor
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types. Equip {2}
item.flavorText: Partisan spies warned that no armor would protect the body from Phyrexian infection. Neurok strategists took that as a challenge.

item.name: Skinwing
Sphere of the Suns
item.text: Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it. {T}, Remove a charge counter from Sphere of the Suns: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

item.name: Spin Engine
item.text: {R}: Target creature can't block Spin Engine this turn.
item.flavorText: "It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory." —Ketuc of the Helm

item.name: Spine of Ish Sah
item.text: When Spine of Ish Sah enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent. When Spine of Ish Sah is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spine of Ish Sah to its owner's hand.

item.name: Strandwalker
Sword of Feast and Famine
Tangle Hulk
item.text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.
item.flavorText: "A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended." —Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

item.name: Thopter Assembly
item.text: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control no Thopters other than Thopter Assembly, return Thopter Assembly to its owner's hand and put five 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

item.name: Titan Forge
item.text: {3}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Titan Forge. {T}, Remove three charge counters from Titan Forge: Put a 9/9 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Training Drone
item.text: Training Drone can't attack or block unless it's equipped.
item.flavorText: "Vulshok flail, Viridian shield, loxodon blade . . . Tazzir, bring the Moriok hook and assemble the rookies." —Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

item.name: Viridian Claw
item.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike. Equip {1}
item.flavorText: "Phyrexians can't corrupt what they can't get close enough to touch."

item.name: Contested War Zone
item.text: Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, that creature's controller gains control of Contested War Zone. {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Inkmoth Nexus
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}: Inkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying and infect until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
